reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros.....nice views, good location near to restos and walking to old city, lovely staff, parking, nice bathroom, good value
reviews.title: basic place, good location, good price

reviews.text: Cons.... bonifacio is building a marina next to the hotel so while not noisy at night, we didn't eat breakfast bc it blocks the views and bc of the noise. Easy to eat at restos nearby for brekkie for 6 euros. Room is slightly dated. Would have been nice to have breakfast on our small terrace.
reviews.title: superb spot in the south

reviews.text: this is the place I see in my dreams. clean, luxurious and right in the port with a view to all the big boats. and walking distance to the action, the restaurants, the tours, the shopping and the citadelle. wow
reviews.title: Solemar hotel Bonifacio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little scruffy round the edges, but the warm welcome and the views really made up for it; it's clean, good parking and the staff could not have been kinder or more welcoming. nb: we came out of season so didn't have any noise from the harbor bars at all so wasn't a problem for us. This is a really good hotel option for Bonifacio.
reviews.title: Harbour view

reviews.text: A lovely spot to stay in, the views were stunning and the room was very good. You could look out over the marine and watch the yachts coming and going.
reviews.title: Hotel in Bonifacio Port

reviews.text: Spent a week in Solemare, on a holiday break. First of all, I would not call it a hotel since it is in an apartment building with some rooms on different floors. Reception and dining room are on the 4th floor. For me, that cannot be called a hotel!
reviews.title: Decent
Si, si, si, si!!!
reviews.text: Rooms are ok, simply furnished, with a/c, nice sea views, which was a plus. Bathrooms is small but kept clean. Food provided for breakfast or other meals if you opt for hb or fb are ok, not plentiful but in most cases tasteful. Those were the positive sides.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negative: most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in (backpain every morning), small shower tab and even smaller shower curtain (flood in bathroom everytime you have a shower), no proper towels but something like a table cloth, almost no english speaking staff (apart from the owner) so it was difficult to communicate what you wanted.
reviews.title: Ideal central location

reviews.text: Location is ok, but mosr hotels are in the vicinity and Sanremo is a small town, so location does not make a big difference.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prices are reasonable and that may be the only reason why you should consider this "hotel". If you are not on a tight budget, you can choose from far better options.
reviews.title: Well worth its two stars
